name: Carv by MotionMetrics
slogan: Digital sports instruction driven by connected devices
description:
Carv is the first wearable tech dedicated to improving your ski technique - it’s your digital ski coach. 

Inspired by Olympic technology, Carv gives you access to the feedback and knowledge that only elite skiers have had access to so far. With an extremely thin smart insert, Carv measures your motion and pressure distribution and relays feedback through your earphones in real-time.

Carv connects wirelessly to your smartphone to give simple, actionable feedback to casual skiers and detailed metrics and analysis for advanced and professional skiers.

Carv lets you train, compete and challenge people with its detailed metrics and helps you improve your skiing with technique analysis.

jobs.title: Customer Service intern (Winter 2020/21)
jobs.description:
At Motion Metrics, we are looking for enthusiastic, friendly and committed Customer Service Interns with an interest in skiing to become key members of our customer experience team for the 2020/21 season.
### About Motion Metrics and Carv 
Motion Metrics is the company behind Carv, the world’s first digital ski coach. We’re a London-based sports technology company that wants to improve the way skiing is taught. Carv gives users real-time coaching and feedback while they ski, based on the analysis of data collected from our super-thin pressure and motion sensing inserts that fit inside the ski boot. The inserts contain over 50 pressure and motion sensors, which relay data to our AI-powered analytics engine before sending advice through the app to the user through their headphones. The user receives coaching in the form of personalised tips, technical drills and videos to help them make the most out of every run.

**Some past press about Carv**
*“*The biggest testament to Carv’s coaching abilities is that I could see my skiing improving in only a few hours.*” - 5 review in Stuff Magazine
*“*Carv is surprisingly addictive*” - Financial Times
*"*The speed with which real-time coaching was ironing out the wrinkles in my technique was striking. There’s no other way to get feedback quite like this. Instructors can only give you a debrief after your descent — and even then it will be based on what they suppose is going on in your boots. Carv’s coaching comes straight from the sole*." - Sunday Times
### About the role
After initial training, the successful applicants will take primary responsibility for all our external communication channels, working closely with the rest of the Carv team to streamline the process and maximise customer satisfaction with the product.

We are looking for outgoing, client-focused individuals, with the ability to produce high quality work both as part of a team and under their own initiative. Previous experience working in a customer-facing role would be advantageous but is not required; a knack for problem-solving is a must. The role would be ideal for a candidate who has just finished university and is looking to spend the winter season in the Alps, while also looking to get an insight into the fast-paced, young, dynamic work environment of a successful sports-tech startup.

**In the role, you will**
* Work closely with the Operations team within Carv, providing a direct impact on the business from day one
* Process and respond to customer queries through all of Carv’s communications channels
* Help answer any queries customers might have before purchase
* Advise customers on the product and how they can best make use of its features
* Help customers to resolve any issues they have with the product 
* Input suggestions and help devise solutions to any new problems under the customer support umbrella.

**Our ideal candidate is someone who is**
* A graduate with a good academic record, or with equivalent experience in a related field
* Friendly and articulate, and fluent in English
* An outgoing person who is organised and diligent
* A skier with a love of the great outdoors and some knowledge of ski technique and equipment
* Effective at communicating in person, over the phone and by email
* Able to form and communicate ideas in a clear and concise manner
* Happy working in close collaboration with team members, while also having the capacity to self-manage and prioritise their workload independently
* Patient and able to deal with difficult or frustrated customers in a positive and professional manner
* Persuasive and can take an enquiry from an interested customer and develop it into a sale further down the line
* Comfortable with and will thrive in a fast-moving and evolving work environment
* Computer literate, with a good knowledge of Google Docs and Sheets, as well as the confidence to get to grips quickly with our internal software systems.
### Location
London (Brixton) until the beginning of December, then either Innsbruck Austria, or London (as preferred) until the end of the internship
### Duration
Between 4 months (mid-November to mid-March) and 7.5 months (mid-September to end of April), depending on the candidate
### Pay / Benefits
* UK National Living Wage 
* Option of working from our Innsbruck office from early December onwards
* Accommodation in Innsbruck
* Innsbruck season pass
* Travel between Innsbruck and London twice
### How to apply
Applications for September start will close on 1st August 2020, although will remain open longer for later start dates. To apply, please send a CV and cover email (no more than 250 words) to rollo@motionmetrics.co

jobs.title: Hardware Intern (Winter 2020/21)
jobs.description:
### About Us
At MotionMetrics, we create digital sports coaching experiences. Our first product is Carv, a digital skiing coach that blends hardware, software and real-time audio instruction to coach people how to ski better - a world first across sports.

We’ve shipped 12,000 units to date and are doubling production every year to keep up with demand. This is an outstanding opportunity to work in a fast growing VC backed sports technology start-up in London, alongside a fantastic team of hardware and software engineers, marketing and customer service experts who are all passionate about changing the paradigm of coaching.

### About the role
We are looking for a hardware intern to help in a variety of roles across the business. This role is perfect for someone who is technically talented, but who also wants to experience the many different parts of a startup and to travel and work abroad.  We expect the internship to be approximately divided as follows:
* **Shenzhen** (1-2 months): you will experience the vibrant ecosystem of “the electronics capital of the world” as you work alongside other startups in HAX, the world’s most prolific hardware program. With the wider hardware team, you will be working with contract manufacturers to ensure the successful shipment of Carv for Christmas. See more about what it’s like working out there from our VP Engineering during this Bloomberg interview: https://bit.ly/2R7Ye27
* **London** (1-2 months): working in our London office a short distance from Brixton station, you will be using the test equipment in our HQ to lead the in-depth testing and characterisation of the new generation of Carv sensors, with support from the wider hardware team. This is where you’ll find the software and marketing teams when they’re not ski testing, so you will have the opportunity to get some insight into the other areas of the business.
* **Innsbruck** (2-3 months): The “heart of the Alps”, Innsbruck is a vibrant and well-connected university town with ski resorts all over the local area - the perfect mountain base. Primary responsibilities will be ski testing the product and acting as the technical lead within the customer service team, debugging both customer issues and warranty requests. There is also the opportunity to aid in the mechanical or electrical development of the next generation of Carv hardware at this stage.


**Your main responsibilities:**
* Helping ensure our factories adhere to our quality control procedures.
* Identifying and diagnosing issues that arise during production, and working with our factories to resolve them.
* Becoming a Solidworks witch/wizard and then using it to design and build various test fixtures for the Carv product.
* Running in-depth characterisation tests on the new Carv units (that you helped to manufacture) to help us continue to improve the product.
* Ski testing and debugging new prototypes in Innsbruck.
* Working with the customer service team to deliver the best experience to the customer.

**Our candidate is someone who:**
* Has a Mechanical or Electrical Engineering (or similar) undergraduate degree with 1st or Upper 2nd class results, or proven knowledge and experience in a similar role.
* Combines analysis skills and attention to detail with a natural engineering intuition.
* Can operate autonomously and is highly self-motivated to learn and solve problems.
* Has a passion for product development. You are enthusiastic, hardworking and proud of your work.
* Has great communication skills and a real empathy for customers and colleagues.

**Nice to have:**
* Experience designing and building mechanical prototypes using CAD software such as Solidworks.
* General workshop skills and knowledge in proper use of hand tools, machine tools etc.
* Experience evaluating ICs and designing and testing PCBs with associated firmware development

### Pay / Benefits
* UK National Living Wage 
* Subsidised accommodation in the company flat in Innsbruck
* Innsbruck ski pass, giving you access to all local resorts for the duration of the season
* Travel between Innsbruck and London

### Duration
7 months from September 2020 to March 2021

### Applications
Please send a CV and short covering email to richard@motionmetrics.co.

jobs.title: iOS Engineer
jobs.description:
At MotionMetrics, we’re working to create digital sports coaching experiences. Our first product is [Carv](https://www.getcarv.com), a digital skiing coach that blends hardware, software and real-time audio instruction to teach people the sport of skiing - a world first across sports.

We’ve shipped 12,000 units to date and are doubling production every year to keep up with demand. This is an outstanding opportunity to work in a fast growing sports technology start-up in London, alongside a fantastic team of hardware and software engineers, marketing and customer service experts who are all passionate about changing the paradigm of coaching.

### More information about Carv
After breaking the Kickstarter sports wearables record in 2016, Carv launched in 2017 and has since coached thousands of skiers.

Carv provides detailed post-run analysis as well as real-time audio instruction as you ski. The instructions are generated by real time analysis of data generated from the Carv pressure and motion inserts, which retrofit into any ski boot.

Developed alongside Olympians and the Professional Ski Instructors of America, Carv’s post-run analysis gives an overall Ski:IQ™, which compares your ability against the rest of the Carv community, allowing skiers to compete with family, friends and even professionals. 

**Advisors and investors include:**
* SOS Ventures
* Virgin
* Steve Rechtschaffner (former CCO of EA Games Canada, creator of SSX Tricky and US Freestyle team member)
* Jeremy Bloom (3x World Champion, 2x Olympian, and 11x World Cup Gold Medalist)

**Here’s what the press are saying:**

* “*The biggest testament to Carv’s coaching abilities is that I could see my skiing improving in only a few hours.*” - 5* review in Stuff Magazine
* “*Carv is surprisingly addictive*” - Financial Times
* "*The speed with which real-time coaching was ironing out the wrinkles in my technique was striking. There’s no other way to get feedback quite like this. Instructors can only give you a debrief after your descent — and even then it will be based on what they suppose is going on in your boots. Carv’s coaching comes straight from the sole.*" - Sunday Times

### About the role
Over the past three ski seasons, we’ve collected terabytes of skiing data covering tens of millions of skiing turns and user instructions. We are looking for a passionate iOS Engineer to develop and maintain Carv’s digital ski coach on iOS so we can help everyone ski better.

You will be working with a tight knit team of people who take pride in producing high quality work. Your primary focus will be to own the delivery of the Carv iOS app.

The successful candidate will have a passion for engineering, as well as sports, finding the right tool for the job, and making an impact on the business.

**In the role, you will:** 	
* Work directly with the CTO
* Have full ownership of the iOS app
* Test your creation on the slopes!

**Our candidate is someone who has:**
* 2+ years of experience developing for iOS
* Well versed in Swift
* Strong frontend skills
* Reactive programming
* Experience with setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
* Always looking into new technologies to improve their productivity and code quality
 
**The following will be a bonus:**
* Apps in the App Store that they are proud of
* CoreBluetooth
* CoreLocation
* CoreMotion

### Location
Our head office is in Brixton, London where most of the team are based throughout the year.

Over winter, you’ll have the opportunity to work from our Mountain HQ in Innsbruck, Austria with access to some of the world’s best ski resorts. You’ll also have access to the company flat out of peak skiing season.
  
### Duration
Full time, immediate start available.
 
### Remuneration	
Competitive with options.

### Applications
Please send a CV and covering email (no more than 250 words) to rollo@motionmetrics.co.
